note.p: Gardener. Born at Manderston, a mansion near Duns, Berwickshire, Scotland, the son of Jane Smith and her husband Thomas Wells, the butler. Married Mary Monro (1810–93), daughter of George Monro, gardener, of Dumfries, Scotland, (formerly of Duns Castle), in Edinburgh in 1836. Employed by H. E. C. S. Stanhope at Holme Lacy, Herefordshire, from at least 1851 to at least 1871. At Osborne Nursery, Potters Bar, from at least 1881.
Census returns of England and Wales 1851 (The National Archives: Public Record Office HO107/1977/6/5), 1861 (RG9/1816/9/12), 1871 (RG10/2690/8/7), 1881 (RG11/1368/87/38), 1891 (RG12/1052/83/43)
